The elections are the one question left the leadership nor the Likud headed by Isaac and expectations. They are to guard the security of Israeli citizens? they are not. They are the only ones want to give up
Congratulations to @MichaelleJeanF on officially assuming the role of Secretary General of La Francophonie today. http://t.co/iAzZTYD1fH
Left this way for 20 years. Left believes that the withdrawal would bring peace, Isaac said that. Not surprisingly leftists repeatedly mistaken political-security issue
Left erred Hezbollah and Hamas are still relevant and have relevant new Middle East - Hdaa"s. They do not realize that if we withdraw, there are those who want to simply destroy us
Left will not require the Palestinians to uproot the root of the conflict and to finally recognize the Jewish state. This is our approach - Likud - and we firmly stand it!
The struggle against extreme Islam allows us to common interests with moderate Arab countries. This is reflected today in ways I can not go
This regional cooperation could ripen responsible future moves. Responsible - if we will lead them. But I am not willing that Israel will lose suicide

I'm not ready to make a withdrawal would endanger our security. I will not give security of Israeli citizens will be given by any third parties other than the Israel Defense Forces. Only we defend ourselves
Upcoming elections to bet on Israel's security. When you're at a critical moment, the ballot box, choose only one ballot that would guarantee our security: this note is Likud - illness, no other
Beyond security there is another reason to vote for the Likud great: to bring real change to the state, change is possible only through a large ruling party
Almost all the reforms that changed the country and boosted the Israeli economy - when the Likud came to the Likud ruling party was great. The list is very long
When I wanted to build a fence along the Egyptian border, opposition arose. But the big Likud managed to build a fence and completely halt infiltration into Israel
The previous government, the IDF decided to move south. The process began to gain momentum, historical change. A few months ago, this revolution was stopped because someone stopped it
Who stopped this finance minister who headed the party atmosphere and decided to stop. Likud was not big enough and that's what happened. Now I am the Minister of Finance; and the army coming south!
Without a large ruling party becomes prime minister and the teacher becomes a blackmailer coalition. So in the coming elections must not waste your vote on sectoral parties or atmosphere
No one party atmosphere that has collapsed. Change, the Center Party, the Pensioners Party, Kadima, has no future, traffic - all disappointed. You can not function with such parties Collection
Beneath the surface we have a serious problem. Israeli politics is crumbling. We decompose SMEs parties, none of them can govern and lead
This problem is so acute that the coalition almost broke up. If there is no change, there will be an election for another two years. My vision: to correct the failure thoroughly
Mdint Isral exists 66 years. This changed during the 33 governments, on average government serves little less than two years. It is a huge toll on the economy and citizens Instability
Duty to change the system. You can change. So go move dramatically change the country. First 100 days in the next Knesset shall make a law that will change the system of government in Israel
"This election ... we can not gamble on the security of Israel!" https://t.co/phq6EsAumy

The ensuing elections, the head of the largest party will form the government automatically. He will serve for four years, it is impossible to overthrow the government except in extreme and very large majority
This move will bring the citizens to assemble the two major parties - Likud or Labor. The public will choose which of them will lead the country
This is the main lesson of mine and I'm sure many of you identify with me. So I ask your support for me to change the system - and a large Likud that would ensure the future of Israel
